short_description: Computes the psalsa score for all nodes in a bipartite graph
long_description: Computes the psalsa score for all nodes in a bipartite graphrepresented by two database tables. The assumption is that the function is provided inputs as in the following example invocation:CREATE TABLE edges (source source_type, target target_type)CREATE TABLE vertices as select distinct source as node from edges union select distinct target from edgesThis function has two arguments -1.'TELEPORTPROB(double)' - provides the damping factor for the psalsa algorithm.2.RANDOMWALKLENGTH(integer) - provides the step number of the random walk which is used to generate the psalsa scorethe target vertex key of an edge.

input_tables.name: vertices
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the vertices, including all the vertices (both hub and authorities), in the bipartite graph
input_tables.description: Specifies the vertices, including all the vertices (both hub and authorities), in the bipartite graph

input_tables.name: edges
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the edges of the bipartite graph
input_tables.description: Specifies the edges of the bipartite graph

input_tables.name: sources
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the “source” vertices in the graph.
input_tables.description: Specifies the “source” vertices in the graph.

input_tables.name: targets
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the “target” vertices in the graph
input_tables.description: Specifies the “target” vertices in the graph

argument_clauses.name: TargetKey
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the target key (the names of the edges table columns that identify the target vertex). If you specify targets_table, then the function uses only the vertices in targets_table as targets (which must be a subset of those that this argument specifies).
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the target key (the names of the edges table columns that identify the target vertex). If you specify targets_table, then the function uses only the vertices in targets_table as targets (which must be a subset of those that this argument specifies).

argument_clauses.name: SourceKey
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the source key (the names of the edges table columns that identify the target vertex). If you specify sources_table, then the function uses only the vertices in sources_table as sources (which must be a subset of those that this argument specifies). The function uses these names to construct the column names for recommended hub nodes in the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the source key (the names of the edges table columns that identify the target vertex). If you specify sources_table, then the function uses only the vertices in sources_table as sources (which must be a subset of those that this argument specifies). The function uses these names to construct the column names for recommended hub nodes in the output table.

argument_clauses.name: EdgeWeight
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the edges table column that contains edge weights. Each edge_weight is a positive value. By default, each edge_weight is 1; that is, the graph is unweighted.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the edges table column that contains edge weights. Each edge_weight is a positive value. By default, each edge_weight is 1; that is, the graph is unweighted.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the vertices table columns to copy to the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the vertices table columns to copy to the output table.

argument_clauses.name: MaxHubNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the maximum number of hub vertices with the highest score output for each hub vertex. The max_hubs must be an INTEGER.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the maximum number of hub vertices with the highest score output for each hub vertex. The max_hubs must be an INTEGER.

argument_clauses.name: MaxAuthorityNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the maximum number of authority vertices with the highest score output for each hub vertex. The max_authority must be an INTEGER.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the maximum number of authority vertices with the highest score output for each hub vertex. The max_authority must be an INTEGER.

argument_clauses.name: TeleportProb
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the possibility ε, a DOUBLE PRECISION value between 0 and 1 that represents the jump to the seed vertex during random walk. The default value is 0.15.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the possibility ε, a DOUBLE PRECISION value between 0 and 1 that represents the jump to the seed vertex during random walk. The default value is 0.15.

argument_clauses.name: RandomWalkLength
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the random walk length L for each hub vertex. L must be an INTEGER. The final hub/authority score is computed as ε*Kv/L, where Kv is the number of times that the random walk visits vertex v. The default value is 5000.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the random walk length L for each hub vertex. L must be an INTEGER. The final hub/authority score is computed as ε*Kv/L, where Kv is the number of times that the random walk visits vertex v. The default value is 5000.
